thread.title: Michigan fans deface Magic statue at Michigan State
thread.title_full: Michigan fans deface Magic statue at Michigan State

author: The Sports Xchange
title: Michigan fans deface Magic statue at Michigan State
text:
Michigan fans deface Magic statue at Michigan State The Sports Xchange 3 hrs ago The Sports Xchange With the battle between in-state rivals Michigan State and Michigan just days away, vandals struck the campus in East Lansing, Mich., on Thursday.
AdChoices Michigan State officials were working to remove a maize 'M' and a "Beat State" inscription that was painted on a status of former Spartans basketball great Magic Johnson outside the Breslin Center in East Lansing, Mich.
"I would like to think that most fans of both schools have a little more class," Michigan State spokesman Jason Cody said, according to the Lansing State Journal.
Two other areas on campus also were vandalized with graffiti overnight.
"Whenever we have situations like this with vandalism on campus, our police to the best of their ability will try to identify suspects," Cody said. "If suspects are identified, they will face criminal charges."
The seventh-ranked Spartans (6-0, 2-0 Big Ten) and the No. 12 Wolverines (5-1, 2-0) meet Saturday at Michigan Stadium in East Lansing, Mich.
Such pranks are nothing new between the schools. The Spartan statue at Michigan State was painted with Michigan colors twice this year. Concerned students stood guard at the Spartan statue this week to make sure a defacing wouldn't occur.
Last year, a block "M" on Michigan's campus was painted green and the letters "S" and "U" were added.
Spartans men's basketball coach Tom Izzo wasn't exactly surprised.
"First, I've gotta say, that this is rivalry week and you're not supposed to like your opponent," Izzo said at Big Ten basketball media day in Chicago. "There's a lot of great Michigan kids, but there's some idiots. There's some idiots on our side, too, that do crazy things.
"Messing with Sparty is a bad thing, like messing with their 'M' is a bad thing. But messing with Magic, that's the worst thing. I'll make sure from now on that maybe the basketball team will sleep (out there)."
